It is characterized by its distinctive foliage, featuring elongated, leaf-like sheaths that encase its stems. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink, typically blooming during the late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Allomarkgrafia insignis is considered a rare and endangered species.
